intro: Bistorta jejuna, commonly known as the slender bistort, is a perennial herb native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features upright, wiry stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are typically greenish-white in color. Bistorta jejuna is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in high-altitude meadows and tundra.
